contextId.occurrenceNote: The eye is a synecdoche for the person whose eye it is. Alternate translation: "I will not pity you" (See: and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: my eye will not have pity on you

contextId.occurrenceNote: Yahweh speaks of the Israelites as if they were a woman who sleeps with many people. Alternate translation: "I was sad because they were like a wife who has left me to sleep with other men" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: I was grieved by their promiscuous heart that turned away from me

contextId.occurrenceNote: Yahweh speaks of the Israelites as if they were a married woman who looks at other men and desires to sleep with them. Alternate translation: "by the way they desired strongly to worship idols" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: by their eyes that whored after their idols

contextId.occurrenceNote: The eye is a synecdoche for the person whose eye it is. Alternate translation: "For I will not pity you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: For my eyes will not pity you

contextId.occurrenceNote: The eye is a synecdoche for the person whose eye it is. Alternate translation: "I will not look on them with compassion" or "I will not be compassionate to them" (See: and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: For my eye will not look compassionately

contextId.occurrenceNote: The hands and knees are synecdoches for the people themselves. Alternate translation: "Everyone will be so terrified that they will be unable to work and their knees will become weak so that they cannot stand" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: Every hand will falter and every knee will be weak as water

contextId.occurrenceNote: The word "hands" is a synecdoche for the people. Alternate translation: "the people of the land will be so afraid that their hands will tremble" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: the hands of the people of the land will tremble in fear

contextId.occurrenceNote: The eye is a synecdoche for the person whose eye it is. Alternate translation: "I will not look on them with compassion" or "I will not be compassionate to them" (See: and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: my eye will not have compassion

contextId.occurrenceNote: The eye is a synecdoche for the person whose eye it is. Alternate translation: "Do not have compassion" (See: and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: Do not let your eyes have compassion

contextId.occurrenceNote: The eye is a synecdoche for the person whose eye it is. Alternate translation: "I will not look on them with compassion" or "I will not be compassionate to them" (See: and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: my eye will not look with compassion

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here the word "heart" represents the person and his emotions. Alternate translation: "discourage the righteous person" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: discourage the heart of the righteous person

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here the word "faces" represents the people. Alternate translation: "Turn back" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: Turn back your faces

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "navel" refers to the umbilical cord that is attached to the navel. Alternate translation: "you mother did not cut your umbilical cord" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: your mother did not cut your navel

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here the word "eye" represents the person who sees. Alternate translation: "Nobody who saw you had compassion for you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: No eye had compassion for you

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "life" represents the person. Alternate translation: "I will hand you over" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: I will hand your life over

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here the word "hands" represents the people who work with their hands. The words "poor" and "needy" emphasize that these are people who cannot help themselves. Alternate translation: "She did not help the people who could not help themselves" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-doublet]])
contextId.glQuote: She did not strengthen the hands of the poor and needy people

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here the word "mouth" represents the person who speaks. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "You did not even mention your sister Sodom" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Sodom your sister was not even mentioned by your mouth

contextId.occurrenceNote: The phrase "strong arm" represents a strong person. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "There will be no need for a strong person or many people to pull it out" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: No strong arm or many people will be needed to pull it out

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here the word "soul" represents the person. Alternate translation: "The person who sins" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: The soul who sins

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here the word "eye" represents Yahweh. Alternate translation: "I spared them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: my eye spared them

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here the word "hand" represents Yahweh and turning his hand away means that he does not do what he was going to do. Alternate translation: "But I did not do that" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: I turned my hand away

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here the word "eyes" represents the person who looks to the idols to worship them. Alternate translation: "They were longing after their fathers' idols" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: Their eyes were longing after their fathers' idols

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here the word "face" represents the person. By mentioning the opposite directions, Yahweh refers to everyone who lives in the north, in the south, and everywhere in between. Alternate translation: "every person who lives in that area" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-merism]])
contextId.glQuote: every face from the south to the north

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here the Israelites are referred to by their "eyes" to emphasize what they see. Alternate translation: "before them" or "before the Israelite people" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: before their eyes

contextId.occurrenceNote: This speaks of people becoming afraid, as if their hearts were fainting. Also, this speaks of the people fainting as a result of fear. Alternate translation: "for everyone will become fearful" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metaphor]])
contextId.glQuote: for every heart will faint away

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here the whole person is referred to by his "heart" to emphasize his emotions and will. Here the idea of "standing" is an idiom that means to be courageous. Alternate translation: "Will you stand" or "Will you be courageous" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: Will your heart stand

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here the whole person is referred to by his "hands." Alternate translation: "will you be strong" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: will your hands be strong

contextId.occurrenceNote: This refers to the house in general. The reference to the "middle" emphasizes that what was done happened openly in the temple and defiled the whole place. Alternate translation: "in my own house" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: in the middle of my house

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "food" refers specifically to meat. Alternate translation: "Place pieces of meat" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: Gather pieces of food

contextId.occurrenceNote: This refers to Ezekiel's wife. Yahweh refers to Ezekiel by the part of his body he uses to see his wife. Alternate translation: "your wife, whom you love very much, from" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: the desire of your eyes from

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here Yahweh refers to the people by their "eyes." Alternate translation: "the building that you delight to look at" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: the delight of your eyes

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here Yahweh refers to the people by their "soul" to emphasize their inner feelings. Alternate translation: "the building that you truly love" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: the yearning of your soul

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here the face represents being in the presence of another person. Alternate translation: "in the presence of" or "before" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: to the face of

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here the "heart" represents the whole person, emphasizing the person's thoughts. Alternate translation: "You were arrogant" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: Your heart was arrogant

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "man's foot" represents people. Alternate translation: "No man will walk through the land of Egypt" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: No man's foot will pass through it

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "animal's foot" represents animals. Alternate translation: "not even a wild animal will walk through it" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: no wild animal's foot will pass through it

contextId.occurrenceNote: The foot here is a synecdoche for the whole person. Alternate translation: "people will no longer stir the waters up with their feet" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: the foot of man will no longer stir the waters up

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "mountains" represents the whole land of Israel. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: against the mountains of Israel

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here, "lips" and "tongues" represent people speaking. Alternate translation: "people are saying bad things about you, and the nations are telling bad stories about you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: you have been the subject of slanderous lips and tongues, and of people's stories

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "you" refers to the mountain of Israel which here represents the trees on the mountain that will grow fruit. Alternate translation: "your trees will grow branches and bear fruit" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: you will grow branches and bear fruit

contextId.occurrenceNote: The tribe of Judah lived in the southern kingdom of Israel which was called Judah. Here the name is used to refer to the whole southern kingdom. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: Judah

contextId.occurrenceNote: Joseph was Ephraim's father. The tribe of Ephraim lived in the northern kingdom of Israel. Here the names are used to represent the whole northern kingdom. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: For Joseph, the branch of Ephraim

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here the people are represented by their "eyes" to emphasize what they see. Alternate translation: "while they watched you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: before their eyes

contextId.occurrenceNote: Gog will not do these things alone. His army will do most of them. Alternate translation: "My army and I will" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: I will

contextId.occurrenceNote: "when the God of Israel had come to destroy the city." If the earlier Hebrew reading "when I had come to destroy the city" is used, then "destroy the city" is a synecdoche for "prophesy that the city will be destroyed." Alternate translation: "when I had come to prophesy that the city will be destroyed" or "when I had come to prophesy that the God of Israel will destroy the city" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: when he had come to destroy the city

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here the Israelites are referred to by their "eyes" to emphasize what they see. See how you translated this in [Ezekiel 21:6](../21/06.md). Alternate translation: "before them" or "before the Israelite people" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: before their eyes
